page.title: 20VIEWS ON VILLAGE LIFE TODAY.
page.content: Parents & children of Amport School who conducted the survey found that many think that villages are no longer close communities. Farm labourers, in thatched cottages, rarely leaving the village,are no more.Their descendants, in council houses, work in Andover. Until they are 11, their children go to the Village School. Then they move to an Andover Comprehensive, make new friends & drift away. Church, School & Pub keep alive the village community according to the Amport Post Mistress. Mr McConnell, author, added the shop. The shopkeeper insisted that local supermarkets had killed village shops which could only offer a service.This included selling video-cassettes. Many loved village life. Mr McConnell said that, without newspapers or radio, one could look around the village and say, "All's well with the world."
